column4: Do you guys believe that installing the ATI 70mb driver for a radeon 6850 is a bad idea? Is it a bad driver?
well, on the 2600 the ATI driver works better than the free driver
yeah, I have a 2600 Mobility here and Urban Terror runs with like 15 fps on free drivers and 127+ with the ati driver
desktop effects work fine with either driver

I seem to have at least three options, one I can enable that comes preinstalled with ubuntu, one I can download through "additional drivers" and the ATI one (which I am not actually sure how to install) How do I get a good comparison between them?
Try them out I'd say. I installed mine through the "additional drivers". Usually, you do not install stuff by downloading it frome website in linux
The additional drivers is the same as the 70mb one, and it worked well for you?
I have to check the size, wait a minute
I do not know where to find the size but I used "ATI/AMD: proprietary FGLRX-Graphics Driver" (translated from German, does not need to be accurate)
So no real issues with your additional drivers download? They work well? I can always uninstall latter right?
it worked two times on this Mac, one on Ubuntu and Kubuntu. You can uninstall the driver later on. You have a backup of your personal files, right?
Not sure what you mean by a backup of my personal files
I mean just in case your computer explodes, you have a copy of your personal data. I do not think anything would happen, but a backup is never a bad idea

I have alot of data to sort out and get off a old drive, then I might be able to use that old drive for backup. But its difficult, most personal data is video files and other things that take up space that the old drive couldn't handle, and keeping up with backups is a pain
well, then just install the driver, personally, I freak out if I do not have my data at least three times ;-)
